location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green, to Thomas Hodges, President and Governor at Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is an update of affairs in the region and contains several items of news and subjects:the arrival in the Gulf of the English fleet that will assist Karim Khan;Skipp's safe arrival at Schyrass [Shiraz];a missing stationery box;the continued prohibition of trade around Bushire and the consequent lack of need for more cloth from India.A postscript, dated 26 March 1768, reports that the fleet left for Bussora [Basra] that morning.
